awd_titl_txt: SBIR Phase II:  Automated People Information Discovery and Mining
awd_abstract_narration:
The broader impact/commercial potential of this Small Business Innovation Research (SBIR) Phase II project results from its potential to transform professional networking from passive to pro-active. People-information is valuable for business professionals in sales, marketing, recruiting, fundraising, M&A and business development, to establish connections, generate leads, and generally maximize opportunities.  This project will further commercialize big data analysis techniques to quickly capture, filter, and analyze people related information from the whole Internet, and present such information to users via mobile and web services for various use cases such as networking at events, etc.  These services will enable mobile users to plan in advance whom they should meet at events, and equip them with much deeper insights regarding their prospects than are currently available, so that they can generate business more efficiently.

This Small Business Innovation Research (SBIR) Phase II project is intended to further develop and commercialize the company's big data analysis and mining technology for people-information, with specific emphasis on making professional networking at events/meetings more productive and efficient. It provides a real-time, instant, "people research" capability on mobile devices to enable effective networking at business events, trade shows, conferences and private/Meetup meetings. It goes beyond existing "name-based" keyword search provided by commonly-used search engines, and is complementary to social network sites, which rely purely on subjective information provided by users themselves. Based on the company's current collaboration with large event organizers and their marketing/sales teams, the project will further extend the event mobile solution for enterprise customers by providing an organizer self-service (SaaS) platform, integrating with their CRMs, and leveraging Beacon technology to track attendee activities and interests in trade shows. In addition, it will include more advanced features to motivate individual users to use the app more frequently, including outside such events. Finally, it will build a platform with APIs to allow OEM partners to generate and use the people-information in activities such as recruiting, marketing, etc.
org_dir_long_name: Directorate for Technology, Innovation, and Partnerships

por.por_cntn:
Whova, the all-in-one event management solution, is designed to enable event organizers to create an organized and engaging event while also providing the most engaging event experiences for their attendees. Whova has been recognized as one of the top market-leading event technologies and is used by more than 6,000 events in over 70 countries. The award-winning Whova event app, Whova registration platform, and time-saving event management software are all popular in the US/Canada, Europe, Australia, Asia, and throughout the rest of the world.  The Whova app is the first event app pioneering attendee networking and engagement functionalities and has the highest ratings in app stores among all event apps. Whova is a winner of multiple Event Technology Awards (in 2016 and 2017), which is regarded throughout the world as the premier award for the event technology sector.

Whova’s technology has transformed professional networking from passive to proactive. Whova commercialized big data analysis techniques to capture, filter, and analyze people-related information from throughout the Internet and present such information to event participants, including general attendees, exhibitors and sponsors, via a mobile event app. The Whova mobile event app users can not only plan whom to meet with and what to talk about based on the deep insight gained from Whova’s SmartProfiles prior to an event, but also virtually network, schedule meetings, exchange e-business cards, start a group chat, and interact more actively with fellow attendees. It helps attendees generate business more effectively at the event, increasing attendee retentions and event organizers’ ROI.

Whova customers include business conferences and expos, association events, community events, academic conferences, networking events, and many more.They particularly value Whova as it helps them engage event participants and boost interactions. The Whova event app consistently reaches 60%-95% in download rate, which is much higher than the industry standard (less than 30-40% in general). For expos and tradeshows, Whova helps organizers attract more exhibitors without spending tons of money and keeps them happy, which is critical to increase event revenue. Whova’s lead generation and retrieval solutions help increase exhibitors’ ROI. They can access a built-in QR scanner, business card scanner, attendee engagements and mobile promotion tools, and attendees’ SmartProfiles,  within one event app, without needing to adopt the expensive, bulky hardware used for traditional expos. Whova has made events modern and trendy with its cutting-edge technology.

Whova provides an organizer with a self-serve (SaaS) platform called the Whova Event Management System (EMS). It enables organizers to efficiently manage an event from beginning to end. By integrating various new Whova innovations into one platform, we automate tedious event management tasks and save organizers 60% of their time. On the Whova EMS, organizers can manage online ticket sales, create an event app within 1-2 hours, create and manage event agenda web pages and speaker web pages with easy-to-use widgets, generate name badges, promote events in event directories on the Web and social media, check in attendees, engage them through mobile announcements, conduct live polling, engage attendees through a bulletin board and gamification tools,monitor real-time statistics, and receive a comprehensive post-event report that is useful in measuring the event’s success. As all the steps are streamlined within one system, organizers do not have to separately handle multiple tools and repeatedly update event content as well as attendee lists among the different tools. Whova has made event organizers’ lives easier.


Last Modified: 11/08/2017
Modified by: Soyeon Park
